Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2008 04:56PM Senora wrote: AbbysMom, thank you so much for your reply.  Your response makes me feel so much better.  I certainly hope mine will do the same.  I will be sure to keep you informed as to what happens after my appointment on Monday.  Thanks again. Senora
Posts.Title: elevated tumor markers Senora msmpatty

Posts.Content: Senora wrote: I just finished (I hope) 6 rounds of taxotere and cytoxan and had chest xrays and tumor marker tests done.  I see my oncologist on Monday, but I found out the results of two of my tumor marker tests today.  My CA 27.29 has me very concerned.  In October it was 19 and now after my chemo it is 42.  Has anyone had their markers increase after completing chemo and what did your oncologist have to say?  I was so hoping that everything would be normal after going through all of this chemo.  Thank you for any information which you can give me.  Needless to say I am quite worried. Senora Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: elevated tumor markers Senora msmpatty
